attributes.action: introduce legislation in protection of the right to freedom of dress.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A proposed Bill - Freedom of dress

s.1 The right of a person in a public place to wear any form of dress, emblem or insignia shall not be infringed, except:

1. A member of a relevant public authority, as specified in Schedule 1, may be required to exclusively wear uniform or insignia of that body during the exercise of his duties; 2. No person not a member of a relevant public authority, as specified in Schedule 1, or a former member, and with the consent of that authority, shall wear uniform or insignia of the same; 3. In the wearing of school uniforms; 4. Where these shall signify an unlawful group or body; 5. Where these shall expressly incite the commission of a criminal act. 

SCHEDULE 1

1 Any police force 2 The Serious Organised Crime Agency 3 The Serious Fraud Office 4 Any of the Secret Intelligence Services 5 Any of HM's armed forces 6 The Revenue and Customs services 7 The Judiciary 8 HM's Courts Service 9 HM's Prison Service 10 HM's Coastguard 11 Any Emergency Service.
